definition: an express train sets off/fig. to work in haste/to rush

to open/to start/to turn on/to boil/to write out (a prescription, check, invoice etc)/to operate (a vehicle)/carat (gold)/abbr. for Kelvin, 開爾文|开尔文[Kai1 er3 wen2]/abbr. for 開本|开本[kai1 ben3], book format
car/vehicle/CL:輛|辆[liang4]/machine/to shape with a lathe/Kangxi radical 159

sentences.english: Steve is a high- stepping motorist.
sentences.chinese: 史提夫是一个开快车的驾车者。

sentences.english: This, then, is why kids are driving slowly.
sentences.chinese: 这就是为什么孩子不开快车了。

sentences.english: Driving fast is no longer a rite of passage.
sentences.chinese: 开快车不再是一种驾驶习惯。

sentences.english: Peter was fined because he was too heavy- footed .
sentences.chinese: 彼得被罚款了，因为他好开快车。

sentences.english: Jack is always egging me on to drive faster.
sentences.chinese: 杰克老是怂恿我开快车。

sentences.english: Paul thinks driving too fast is exciting.
sentences.chinese: 保罗认为开快车很令人兴奋。

sentences.english: James tends to drive too fast.
Maybe drivers feel they are okay and driving fast seems very cool.
sentences.chinese: 也许司机们认为自己能开吧，而且开快车似乎很酷。

sentences.english: We all like to drive fast.
The driver who likes to drive too fast will pay for that driving habit.
sentences.chinese: 喜欢开快车的驾驶人将为那个驾驶习惯付出代价。

sentences.english: It’s not safe, but I love driving fast.
sentences.chinese: 尽管不安全，但我还是喜欢开快车。

sentences.english: It's too dangerous to drive fast on busy streets.
sentences.chinese: 在交通忙碌的街道上开快车，实在是太危险了。

sentences.english: He received a fine for driving too fast.
sentences.chinese: 因为开快车，他收到了一张罚款单。

sentences.english: She has a mania for driving fast.
If you drive so fast in the speed-limited area, you will be asking for trouble.
sentences.chinese: 如果你在限速区开快车，你可是自找麻烦。

sentences.english: B:Be careful.It's dangerous to drive fast.
sentences.chinese: 小心点儿吧，开快车太危险。

definition: to exceed the speed limit/to speed/high-speed
to drive a vehicle/movement of vehicles
to brake (when driving)/to stop/to switch off/to check (bad habits)/a brake
traffic jam/(of traffic) to get congested
to burn the midnight oil/to work late into the night
to step on the brake/to brake (when driving)
